results.title: Uniroyal Australia
results.brief_description:
A non-narrated and detailed look at the entire process of tyre-making at the Uniroyal plant in South Australia. Indicates the testing process as well as showing other products made at the Uniroyal plant - polyurethane moulded car fascia panels, seats, armrests and loungeroom furniture.
Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Union at work: this is TWUA
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Rogin, Rosemarie Hickson, Albert Hemsing and Textile Workers Union of America
results.brief_description: The official story of the Textile Workers Union of America. Working through 800 locals, involving a membership of 450,000, the union carries out an extensive program of work bringing many benefits to its members. Filmed in the mills, on the picket lines, in union halls and in the homes of members, the film not only underlines the benefits of union membership but also stresses the rights and obligations of working people everywhere. Narrated by Joseph Julian.

results.title: Understanding sexuality (with booklet)
results.brief_description: An educational video with accompanying booklet featuring Professor Derek Llewellyn-Jones, professor of obstetrics and gynaecology at the University of Sydney discussing subjects such as sexuality, puberty, menstruation, sexual behaviour, contraception, pregnancy and abortion, sexual diseases and sexual responsibility with a group of adolescents.

results.title: Understanding movies
results.brief_description: Presents a study of motion picture technique through excerpts from the MGM films: Tennessee Johnson, The Good Earth, Treasure Island, David Copperfield and, Romeo and Juliet. Highlights directing, acting, photography and editing as well as art and music. All excerpts from pictures produced and copyrighted by Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer.

results.title: Understanding Herbal Medicine
results.brief_description: This program is a practical guide to basic herbal medicine. Common herbs are listed and their therapeutic qualities are described. An informative guide to alternative remedies for everyday health problems.

results.title: Understanding color: color by addition
results.brief_description: The basic principles governing the addition of primary colors of light are explored. The film shows how the different hues of colored light are produced. In a special color television sequence, we see the best known example of color by addition.

results.title: Understanding Auslan
results.brief_description: This video is an instructional and entertaining look at the different types of sign language which exist around the world. It explains the development of Auslan - Australian Sign Language - in Australia, why there are variations in signing between states and countries and generations, the grammatical differences between Auslan and English, and a basic introduction to Auslan. The video is presented with a voiceover and subtitles for the hearing impaired.

results.title: Underground film
results.brief_description: A study of the underground film movement, and independent filmmakers, as exemplified by Chick Strand and her work. Presents examples of underground films and from Strand’s award winning film ‘Anselmo’ to demonstrate the experimental and improvisational nature of this art form. Shows the distribution and presentation of underground films in the US. Strand’s partner is also shown working on the cover art for Frank Zappa’s the Mothers of Invention album ‘Weasels Ripped my Flesh’. Music by Jason and Spencer.

results.title: Unconditional surrender
results.brief_description: Shows the production of polio vaccine in a large pharmaceutical laboratory and describes the licensing procedures at the National Institute of Health. Features President Eisenhower and his grandchild, RAndy Kerr, the first child to receive the vaccine in 1954. Also features Dr Jonas Salk.
